events.title: Cal Invitational Speech and Debate Tournament
events.description: An annual tournament featuring a mix of speech and debate events, including in-person and online divisions.

events.title: Symposium / Multiple Offerings: New Directions in Research on Theresa Hak Kyung Cha
events.description: A symposium highlighting new directions in research on Theresa Hak Kyung Cha, featuring contributions from graduate students and early career researchers.

events.title: Light Catcher Workshop
events.description: A workshop where participants explore photography and light combined with ancestral memory, inspired by MATRIX exhibition artist Andro Eradze. RSVP required.

events.title: Exhibition Tour: Theresa Hak Kyung Cha: Multiple Offerings
events.description: Graduate students from Art History, English, and Ethnic Studies lead tours of the 'Theresa Hak Kyung Cha: Multiple Offerings' exhibition.

events.title: Gösta Berling’s Saga (Parts 1 & 2) Film Screening
events.description: A screening of 'Gösta Berling’s Saga', presented in two parts.

events.title: Open: Art Lab
events.description: A drop-in session at the museum's Fisher Family Art Lab where visitors of all ages can explore their creativity through hands-on art-making.

events.title: Robert Beavers: Program 5 - Model (Film Screening)
events.description: A screening of Frederick Wiseman's 1980 documentary film 'Model', capturing the inner workings of a New York fashion modeling agency.

events.title: Two English Girls (Film Screening)
events.description: A screening of François Truffaut's 1971 film 'Two English Girls', featuring stunning cinematography and a swooning score.

events.title: UndocuGrads: 25-26 Life After Berkeley Webinars
events.description: A series of webinars in partnership with DreamCo, exploring academic and career planning options for undocumented students after college or graduate school at Berkeley.

events.title: Choco-love Extravaganza!
events.location: Inclusive Excellence Hub, 2515 Channing Way, Room 103
events.description: A relaxed craft and game night featuring lanyard-making, fun board games, delicious dinner, and chocolate fountains for dessert.

events.title: Valentine's Day Treats & Crafts
events.description: Celebrate Valentine's Day with friends at the Student Union, enjoying free treats and crafts.

events.title: Movie Screening: She's the Man
events.description: A fun movie night with friends featuring a screening of the romantic comedy 'She's the Man'. Free to all UC Berkeley students.

events.title: Lunar New Year Event
events.description: Celebrate the Year of the Horse with free activities for UC Berkeley students.

events.title: Crafter Dark – Blind Box Charms
events.description: An event hosted in partnership with Cub Concerts at Berkeley, where participants can make their own blind box charms. Free to all UC Berkeley students.

events.title: Black History Month Celebration
events.description: An event to honor Black History Month, featuring free treats and showcasing local black-owned businesses on campus.

events.title: Drag Bingo
events.description: An unforgettable night filled with laughter, prizes, and treats hosted by Thee Leggy Pee.

events.title: Annual Authors Dinner & Auction
events.description: A much-anticipated annual gala honoring local authors and spotlighting the Bay Area's literary tradition. Proceeds support library innovations and literacy projects.

events.title: 3rd Saturday Shoreline Cleanup - February
events.location: Shorebird Nature Center, 160 University Ave, Berkeley, CA 94710
events.description: Join volunteers to help clean litter off the shorelines, with a focus on plastic pollution. Meet at Shorebird Park Nature Center.

events.title: 50th Year Anniversary Banff Centre Mountain Film Festival World Tour
events.description: The Adventures Team at UC Berkeley Recreation and Wellbeing presents the 50th annual Banff Centre Mountain Film Festival World Tour.

events.title: UCBHSSP Workshop for Educators: Content Modification Protocol
events.description: A workshop for educators supporting Newcomers and Multi-Language Learners, focusing on the Content Modification Protocol developed by UCBHSSP.

events.title: CODEX Book Art Fair: Public Hours (Day 2)
events.location: Oakland Marriott City Center, 1001 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94607
events.description: The international biennial CODEX Book Art Fair showcasing artists' books and fine press publications.

events.title: CODEX Book Art Fair: Public Hours (Day 3)
events.location: Oakland Marriott City Center, 1001 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94607
events.description: The international biennial CODEX Book Art Fair showcasing artists' books and fine press publications.

events.title: CODEX Book Art Fair: Public Hours (Day 4)
events.location: Oakland Marriott City Center, 1001 Broadway, Oakland, CA 94607
events.description: The international biennial CODEX Book Art Fair showcasing artists' books and fine press publications.

events.title: CODEX Symposium (Day 1)
events.location: Oakland Marriott City Center, East Ballroom
events.description: A symposium featuring talks related to the art of the book, bringing together practitioners, scholars, and enthusiasts.

events.title: CODEX Symposium (Day 2)
events.location: Oakland Marriott City Center, East Ballroom
events.description: A symposium featuring talks related to the art of the book, bringing together practitioners, scholars, and enthusiasts.

events.title: Discovery Station: Newts
events.description: Drop in to learn about newts from volunteer docents, with information and an up-close look.

events.title: 2026 Clark Kerr Lectures: The American University in Crisis – Evolving Conditions (Part 1)
events.organizer: Center for Studies in Higher Education (UC Berkeley School of Law)
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law, Booth Auditorium
events.description: The first lecture by Princeton University President Christopher Eisgruber, focusing on major trends affecting the American research university model.

events.title: 2026 Clark Kerr Lectures: The American University in Crisis – Contested Missions (Part 2)
events.organizer: Center for Studies in Higher Education (UC Berkeley School of Law)
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law, Booth Auditorium
events.description: The second lecture by Princeton University President Christopher Eisgruber, examining the role of university presidents and the civic mission of American research universities.

events.title: The Buzz w/ BCLB Beyond Delaware: Should startups incorporate in Nevada?
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Law (Berkeley Center for Law and Business - BCLB)
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A discussion on startup incorporation strategies, specifically exploring the option of Nevada.

events.title: Law, Economics, and Social Science Colloquium: “Tariffs as Fiscal Policy”
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A colloquium discussing tariffs in the context of fiscal policy within law, economics, and social science.

events.title: Being a Judge in Korea Today
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A discussion providing insights into the experience and role of a judge in Korea's contemporary legal system.

events.title: A Discussion with P.G. Sittenfeld
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A discussion session featuring P.G. Sittenfeld.

events.title: ASP Workshop: Effective Outlining
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: An Academic Success Program workshop focusing on strategies for effective outlining for law students.

events.title: Constituency Building in the Age of Authoritarianism with Gina Clayton-Johnson
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A discussion with Gina Clayton-Johnson on constituency building strategies in a challenging political climate.

events.title: ASP Workshop: Early Bar Study
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: An Academic Success Program workshop providing guidance on preparing for the bar exam early.

events.title: Conversations on Civil Justice: “Federal Officer Liability”
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A focused conversation on the topic of federal officer liability within civil justice.

events.title: Free Coffee and Tea for Students
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Exact Location TBD)
events.description: A social event offering complimentary coffee and tea for law students.

events.title: Mindful Monday
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Exact Location TBD)
events.description: A short session dedicated to mindfulness for law students, promoting well-being.

events.title: Courts & Judicial Process Colloquium | The New Emergency Law
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A colloquium examining 'The New Emergency Law' within the context of courts and judicial processes.

events.title: Marine AI, Autonomy, and the Internet of Things in the Law of the Sea
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A discussion on the intersection of artificial intelligence, autonomy, and the Internet of Things with the Law of the Sea.

events.title: BCLB Business Law Practice Area Workshop: From Code to Contract – Tech Transactions with Freshfields
events.organizer: UC Berkeley Law (Berkeley Center for Law and Business - BCLB)
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A workshop focused on tech transactions within business law, with insights from Freshfields.

events.title: Requesting Accommodations on MPRE & Bar Exam
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Law (Room TBD)
events.description: A workshop providing guidance and information on the process of requesting accommodations for the MPRE and Bar Exam.

events.title: Integral Taiji and Qigong
events.description: A Friday late morning class focusing on Integral Taiji & Qigong practices.

events.title: FULL: Symbiosis & Cocktails: Lichen Love
events.description: An event exploring the symbiosis of lichens, possibly with a social component. (Note: Event is full).

events.title: FULL: FAMILY PROGRAM: Botanical Valentine's Tea (Morning Session)
events.description: A family-friendly program for Valentine's Day. (Note: Event is full).

events.title: FULL: FAMILY PROGRAM: Botanical Valentine's Tea (Afternoon Session)
events.description: A family-friendly program for Valentine's Day. (Note: Event is full).

events.title: Discovery Station: Newts
events.description: Drop in to learn about newts from volunteer docents, with information and an up-close look.

events.title: Botanical Illustration: Spring Bulbs
events.description: A workshop focused on the art of botanical illustration, specifically featuring spring bulbs.

events.title: Botanical Illustration: Spring Bulbs (Saturday)
events.description: A Saturday workshop focused on the art of botanical illustration, specifically featuring spring bulbs.

events.title: Plein AiR Patrol with Forest Stearns
events.description: An outdoor art event with Forest Stearns, likely involving plein air art creation.

events.title: Member Event: Member Morning
events.description: A special morning event for members of the UC Botanical Garden.

events.title: Garden Shop Spring Clearance Sale
events.description: A spring clearance sale offering various items at the Garden Shop.

events.title: Seminar with Eva Harris, PhD (Infectious Diseases and Vaccinology)
events.organizer: UC Berkeley School of Public Health
events.location: UC Berkeley School of Public Health (Exact Location TBD)
events.description: A seminar featuring Dr. Eva Harris, Professor and Chair of Infectious Diseases and Vaccinology.

events.title: Community Experiment: How well AI can do research math (Solutions Posted)
events.organizer: Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing
events.description: Solutions will be posted for a community experiment designed to measure the ability of AI to perform research-level mathematics.

events.title: First Saturday Writing Workshop "What your Narrator Knows"
events.description: A 90-minute online workshop addressing different writing topics each month, with presentations, prompts, writing, and workshopping.

events.title: Robert Beavers: Program 7
events.description: A screening of Robert Beavers's films, showcasing his continued interest in poetic form and emotions linked to a sense of home or place. Includes a conversation with Robert Beavers and Susan Oxtoby.

events.title: Epicenter - The Struggle to Bring Black Studies to Higher Education in The Bay Area
events.location: International House, 2299 Piedmont Ave, Berkeley, CA
events.description: Premiere of a documentary film by Doug and Douglas Harris, presented in partnership with the Office of University Development and Alumni Relations and the Department of African American Studies.

events.title: California Women's Golf vs Ohio State University
events.location: Tournament (location not specified, representing UC Berkeley)
events.description: UC Berkeley Women's Golf team competes against Ohio State University.

events.title: California Men's Tennis vs UC Davis
events.description: UC Berkeley Men's Tennis team competes against UC Davis.

events.title: California Golden Bears Men's Basketball vs No. 20/19 Clemson
events.description: The Golden Bears Men's Basketball team hosts No. 20/19 Clemson in their final home game before a road trip.

events.title: 3-Manifold Seminar: Properties of the figure eight knot
events.description: A seminar discussing the properties of the figure eight knot within 3-manifold theory.

events.title: SURF L&S, Rose Hills, and Haas Scholars Application Workshop (Arts & Humanities)
events.description: An application workshop for students interested in SURF L&S, Rose Hills, and Haas Scholars programs within Arts & Humanities.

events.title: Classical Concert in the Florilegium with Left Coast Chamber Ensemble
events.description: Enjoy this special noon concert featuring musicians from the Left Coast Chamber Ensemble.

events.title: Gallery Tour | Flowing through Time and Tradition
events.location: Magnes Collection of Jewish Art and Life
events.description: A free monthly gallery talk with the curator of the new exhibition, 'Flowing through Time and Tradition'.

events.title: Film Screening – “The Phantom Carriage” with Introduction by Linda Haverty Rugg
events.description: A screening of 'The Phantom Carriage' in a new digital restoration, introduced by UC Berkeley Professor Linda Haverty Rugg and accompanied by live piano.

events.title: Beit Midrash Study Session | The First Water is the Body: Tracing Streams
events.description: A creative, collaborative study session inspired by the art and objects on view in 'Flowing through Time and Tradition', led by Dan Alter.

events.title: Steven Banks and Xak Bjerken: Golden Silhouettes
events.description: Saxophonist Steven Banks, the first saxophonist to win the Avery Fisher Career Grant, performs with Xak Bjerken in his Cal Performances debut.

events.title: Film Screening – “Robert Beavers: Program 4” with Erik Ulman Conversation
events.description: A screening of Robert Beavers's films from his cycle, creating connections between varied times and places, followed by a conversation with Erik Ulman.

events.title: Weekly CrafterDark at Anchor House
events.description: Another weekly craft session offering free crafting and art making.

events.title: Film Screening – ”2046” (4K Digital Restoration)
events.description: A screening of Wong Kar Wai's '2046' in a 4K digital restoration, echoing 'In the Mood For Love'.

events.title: Sick Plant Clinic
events.description: Our monthly Sick Plant Clinic offers expert advice to help diagnose plant diseases or pests. Bring your plant samples for assistance.
